com.dhemery.expressing
Class Expressive

java.lang.Object
  com.dhemery.expressing.Expressive

public class Expressive
extends Object

Expressive methods to make assertions, wait for conditions, and establish preconditions before taking an action.

Constructor Summary
protected Expressive()
          Initialize Expressive to get its poller and default ticker by calling methods in the derived class.
protected Expressive(Publisher publisher, Ticker defaultTicker)
          Initialize Expressive to use the given poller and default ticker.
protected Expressive(Supplier<Publisher> publisherSupplier, Supplier<Ticker> tickerSupplier)
          Initialize Expressive to get its publisher and default ticker from the given suppliers.

Constructor Detail

Expressive

protected Expressive(Publisher publisher,
                     Ticker defaultTicker)
Initialize Expressive to use the given poller and default ticker.

Expressive

protected Expressive(Supplier<Publisher> publisherSupplier,
                     Supplier<Ticker> tickerSupplier)
Initialize Expressive to get its publisher and default ticker from the given suppliers. Expressive will call the publisher supplier once, before it conducts its first poll. Expressive will call the ticker supplier once, before it conducts its first poll that uses the default ticker.

Parameters:
publisherSupplier - supplies the publisher for this Expressive to use
tickerSupplier - supplies the default ticker for this Expressive to use

Expressive

protected Expressive()
Initialize Expressive to get its poller and default ticker by calling methods in the derived class. Expressive will call getPublisher() once, before it conducts its first poll. Expressive will call getTicker() once, before it conducts its first poll that uses the default ticker.

IMPORTANT: If you use this constructor, you must override getPublisher() and getTicker().

Method Detail

getTicker

protected Ticker getTicker()
If you inizialized this Expressive using the no-args Expressive() constructor, you must override getTicker() to provide the default ticker for Expressive to use.

Returns:
the default ticker for Expressive to use

getPublisher

protected Publisher getPublisher()
If you inizialized this Expressive using the no-args Expressive() constructor, you must override getPoller() to provide the poller for Expressive to use.

Returns:
the poller for Expressive to use

eventually

protected Ticker eventually()
Return the default ticker. This method is named to read nicely in expressions.

Example:

 View settingsView = ...;
 Feature<View,Boolean> visible() { ... }
 assertThat(settingsView, eventually(), is(visible()));

publisher

protected Publisher publisher()
Return the publisher to which this Expressive publishes polling events.

assertThat

public static void assertThat(Condition condition)
Assert that the condition is true.

Example:

 Condition lifeIsButADream = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(lifeIsButADream);

assertThat

public void assertThat(Ticker ticker,
                       Condition condition)
Assert that the condition is satisfied during a poll.

Example:

 Ticker withinTenSeconds = ...;
 Condition launchIsInProgress = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(withinTenSeconds, launchIsInProgress);

assertThat

public static <V> void assertThat(Sampler<V> variable,
                                  org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super V> criteria)
Assert that a sample of the variable satisfies the criteria.

Example:

 Sampler<Integer> threadCount = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(threadCount, is(9));

assertThat

public static void assertThat(Sampler<Boolean> variable)
Assert that a sample of the variable is true.

Example:

 Sampler<Boolean> theresAFlyInMySoup = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(theresAFlyInMySoup);

assertThat

public <V> void assertThat(Sampler<V> variable,
                           Ticker ticker,
                           org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super V> criteria)
Assert that a polled sample of the variable satisfies the criteria.

Example:

 Sampler<Integer> threadCount = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(threadCount, eventually(), is(9));

assertThat

public void assertThat(Ticker ticker,
                       Sampler<Boolean> variable)
Assert that a polled sample of the variable is true.

Example:

 Sampler<Boolean> theresAFlyInMySoup = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(eventually(), theresAFlyInMySoup);

assertThat

public static <S,V> void assertThat(S subject,
                                    Feature<? super S,V> feature,
                                    org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super V> criteria)
Assert that a sample of the feature satisfies the criteria.

Example:

 TextField userNameField = ...;
 Feature<TextField,Color> textColor() { ... }
 Matcher<Color> blue() { ... }
 ...
 assertThat(userNameField, textColor(), is(blue()));

assertThat

public static <S> void assertThat(S subject,
                                  Feature<? super S,Boolean> feature)
Assert that a sample of the feature is true.

Example:

 Page settingsPage = ...;
 Feature<Page,Boolean> displayed() { ... }
 ...
 assertThat(settingsPage, is(displayed()));

assertThat

public <S,V> void assertThat(S subject,
                             Feature<? super S,V> feature,
                             Ticker ticker,
                             org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super V> criteria)
Assert that a polled sample of the feature satisfies the criteria.

Example:

 Page searchResultsPage = ...;
 Feature<Page,Boolean> resultCount() { ... }
 Ticker withinTenSeconds = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(searchResultsPage, resultCount(), withinTenSeconds, is(greaterThan(9)));

assertThat

public <S> void assertThat(S subject,
                           Ticker ticker,
                           Feature<? super S,Boolean> feature)
Assert that a polled sample of the feature is true.

Example:

 Page settingsPage = ...;
 Feature<Page,Boolean> displayed() { ... }
 ...
 assertThat(settingsPage, eventually(), is(displayed()));
